9 /*=====================================================================
10  * PLEASE GO READ THE DOCUMENTATION!
11  * ------------------------------------------------
12  * $tarball_directory/doc/doxygen-doc/
13  * or
14  * http://www.open-mpi.org/projects/hwloc/doc/
15  *=====================================================================
16  *
17  * FAIR WARNING: Do NOT expect to be able to figure out all the
18  * subtleties of hwloc by simply reading function prototypes and
19  * constant descrptions here in this file.
20  *
21  * Hwloc has wonderful documentation in both PDF and HTML formats for
22  * your reading pleasure. The formal documentation explains a LOT of
23  * hwloc-specific concepts, provides definitions, and discusses the
24  * "big picture" for many of the things that you'll find here in this
25  * header file.
26  *
27  * The PDF/HTML documentation was generated via Doxygen; much of what
28  * you'll see in there is also here in this file. BUT THERE IS A LOT
29  * THAT IS IN THE PDF/HTML THAT IS ***NOT*** IN hwloc.h!
30  *
31  * There are entire paragraph-length descriptions, discussions, and
32  * pretty prictures to explain subtle corner cases, provide concrete
33  * examples, etc.
34  *
35  * Please, go read the documentation. :-)
36  *
37  * Moreover there are several examples of hwloc use under doc/examples
38  * in the source tree.
39  *
40  *=====================================================================*/

163 typedef enum {
164  /* ***************************************************************
165  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
166 
167  If new enum values are added here, you MUST also go update the
168  obj_type_order[] and obj_order_type[] arrays in src/topology.c.
169 
170  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
171  *************************************************************** */
172 
173  HWLOC_OBJ_SYSTEM,
178  HWLOC_OBJ_MACHINE,
183  HWLOC_OBJ_NUMANODE,
187  HWLOC_OBJ_PACKAGE,
191  HWLOC_OBJ_CACHE,
194  HWLOC_OBJ_CORE,
198  HWLOC_OBJ_PU,
207  HWLOC_OBJ_GROUP,
220  HWLOC_OBJ_MISC,
226  HWLOC_OBJ_BRIDGE,
233  HWLOC_OBJ_PCI_DEVICE,
238  HWLOC_OBJ_OS_DEVICE,
244  HWLOC_OBJ_TYPE_MAX
246  /* ***************************************************************
247  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
248 
249  If new enum values are added here, you MUST also go update the
250  obj_type_order[] and obj_order_type[] arrays in src/topology.c.
251 
252  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
253  *************************************************************** */
254 } hwloc_obj_type_t;

323 struct hwloc_obj_memory_s {
324  hwloc_uint64_t total_memory;
325  hwloc_uint64_t local_memory;
328  unsigned page_types_len;
334  struct hwloc_obj_memory_page_type_s {
335  hwloc_uint64_t size;
336  hwloc_uint64_t count;
337  } * page_types;
338 };
339 
344 struct hwloc_obj {
345  /* physical information */
346  hwloc_obj_type_t type;
347  unsigned os_index;
351  char *name;
353  struct hwloc_obj_memory_s memory;
355  union hwloc_obj_attr_u *attr;
358  /* global position */
359  unsigned depth;
364  unsigned logical_index;
368  signed os_level;
370  /* cousins are all objects of the same type (and depth) across the entire topology */
371  struct hwloc_obj *next_cousin;
372  struct hwloc_obj *prev_cousin;
374  /* children of the same parent are siblings, even if they may have different type and depth */
375  struct hwloc_obj *parent;
376  unsigned sibling_rank;
377  struct hwloc_obj *next_sibling;
378  struct hwloc_obj *prev_sibling;
380  /* children array below this object */
381  unsigned arity;
382  struct hwloc_obj **children;
383  struct hwloc_obj *first_child;
384  struct hwloc_obj *last_child;
386  /* misc */
387  void *userdata;
392  /* cpusets and nodesets */
393  hwloc_cpuset_t cpuset;
406  hwloc_cpuset_t complete_cpuset;
417  hwloc_cpuset_t online_cpuset;
425  hwloc_cpuset_t allowed_cpuset;
436  hwloc_nodeset_t nodeset;
453  hwloc_nodeset_t complete_nodeset;
467  hwloc_nodeset_t allowed_nodeset;
480  struct hwloc_distances_s **distances;
481  unsigned distances_count;
482 
483  struct hwloc_obj_info_s *infos;
484  unsigned infos_count;
486  int symmetric_subtree;
491 };
495 typedef struct hwloc_obj * hwloc_obj_t;
496 
498 union hwloc_obj_attr_u {
500  struct hwloc_cache_attr_s {
501  hwloc_uint64_t size;
502  unsigned depth;
503  unsigned linesize;
504  int associativity;
506  hwloc_obj_cache_type_t type;
507  } cache;
509  struct hwloc_group_attr_s {
510  unsigned depth;
511  } group;
513  struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s {
514  unsigned short domain;
515  unsigned char bus, dev, func;
516  unsigned short class_id;
517  unsigned short vendor_id, device_id, subvendor_id, subdevice_id;
518  unsigned char revision;
519  float linkspeed; /* in GB/s */
520  } pcidev;
522  struct hwloc_bridge_attr_s {
523  union {
524  struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s pci;
525  } upstream;
526  hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t upstream_type;
527  union {
528  struct {
529  unsigned short domain;
530  unsigned char secondary_bus, subordinate_bus;
531  } pci;
532  } downstream;
533  hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t downstream_type;
534  unsigned depth;
535  } bridge;
537  struct hwloc_osdev_attr_s {
538  hwloc_obj_osdev_type_t type;
539  } osdev;
540 };
541 
555 struct hwloc_distances_s {
556  unsigned relative_depth;
558  unsigned nbobjs;
563  float *latency;
575  float latency_max;
576  float latency_base;
580 };
